publication.title: Learning from Nature to Build Intelligent Autonomous Robots
HERMES - an Intelligent Humanoid Robot Designed and Tested for Dependability
Machine Vision for Intelligent Robots
publication.abstract: Vision is an ideal sensor modality for intelligent robots. It provides rich information on the environment as required for recognizing objects and understanding situations in real time. Moreover, vision-guided robots may be largely calibration-free, which is a great practical advantage. Three vision-guided robots and their design concepts are introduced: an autonomous indoor vehicle, a calibration- free manipulator arm, and a

publication.title: Design Principles for Dependable Robotic Assistants
A noise model for mass spectrometry based proteomics
publication.authors: peicheng du,gustavo stolovitzky,peter horvatovich,jihyeon lim,frank suits
publication.keyword: Goodness of Fit;Ion Trap;Mass Spectrometry;Noise Reduction;poisson model;poisson noise;Retention Time;Error Rate;Time of Flight;
publication.abstract: Motivation: Mass spectrometry data are subjected to considerable noise. Good noise models are required for proper detection and quantification of peptides. We have characterized noise in both quadrupole time-of-flight (Q-TOF) and ion trap data, and have constructed models for the noise. Results: We find that the noise in Q-TOF data from Applied Biosystems QSTAR fits well to a combination of
